meanings.definition: A robbery or theft carried out using a weapon, typically a gun.
meanings.sent1: The news reported a series of stickups in the downtown area.
meanings.sent2: The police are investigating a stickup at the local convenience store.
meanings.sent3: The stickup at the bank was so unexpected that even the security guard was surprised.
meanings.sent4: The stickup felt like a scene from a movie, with the robber demanding money at gunpoint.
meanings.sent5: The stickup left a lasting fear in the minds of the witnesses.

meanings.definition: A type of adhesive strip used to attach objects to surfaces.
meanings.sent1: I used stickups to hang up my favorite posters in my room.
meanings.sent2: The stickups kept falling off the wall because they weren't strong enough.
meanings.sent3: The stickups were so sticky that they accidentally attached to my fingers.
meanings.sent4: The stickups held the picture frame in place like magic.
meanings.sent5: The stickups were a lifesaver when it came to organizing my desk.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase or rise in something, such as prices or crime rates.
meanings.sent1: The stickups in gas prices have made it difficult for people to afford driving.
meanings.sent2: There was a stickup in the number of reported thefts last month.
meanings.sent3: The stickup in ice cream sales was due to the hot weather.
meanings.sent4: The stickup in online shopping has changed the way we buy things.
meanings.sent5: The stickup in crime rates has led to increased police presence in the area.
